what: A sample dataset containing labeled bills from the United State Congress. — USCongress

title: A sample dataset containing labeled bills from the United State Congress. — USCongress
A sample dataset containing labeled bills from the United State Congress. — USCongress
text: tibble containing six columns. ID unique identifier bill. cong session congress bill first appeared. billnum number bill appears congressional docket. h_or_sen field specifying whether bill introduced   House (HR) Senate (S). major manually labeled topic code corresponding subject bill. text short text description bill.

title: A sample dataset containing labeled bills from the United State Congress. — USCongress
text: First included RTextTools package (now deprecated). Original source http://www.congressionalbills.org/.

title: Bechdel test — bechdel
text: dataset containing Bechdel test scores sample films 1970-2013.

title: Bechdel test — bechdel
text: data frame 1394 rows 10 variables: year Year film released. title Film title. test Whether film passed failed test. Pass requires film least two named women talk something man budget_2013 Film's budget millions dollars (inflation-adjusted 2013). domgross_2013 Domestic gross revenue millions dollars (inflation-adjusted 2013). intgross_2013 International gross revenue millions dollars (inflation-adjusted 2013). rated MPAA film rating. metascore Metacritic film score (0-100). imdb_rating IMDB film rating (0-10). genre Primary genre film.

title: Generate 95% confidence intervals — ci
text: Function generate 95% confidence intervals using output augment. add_ci generates 95 using fitted values standard errors, plot_ci generates ggplot line chart.

title: Generate 95% confidence intervals — ci
text: df_augment Output augment. df_ci Output add_ci. x Name variable plot x-axis, passed string.

what: Chicago Public Schools school ratings — cps
title: Chicago Public Schools school ratings — cps
text: dataset containing variables Chicago Public Schools.

title: Chicago Public Schools school ratings — cps
Chicago Public Schools school ratings — cps
text: data frame 654 rows 18 variables: school_id CPS School ID indicated school. short_name Short Name Public School Chicago. school_type Type Public School Chicago (example, Neighborhood/Charter/etc. primary_category ES indicates elementary school; MS indicates middle school;    HS indicates high school student_growth_rating Student Growth measures change standardized test scores two points time.    growth compared average national growth schools started place.     50th percentile score means school grew rate national average. student_attainment_rating Measures well school performed standardized test single point time.    school's scores compared national average scores.     50th percentile score means school performing level national average school. culture_climate_rating Results based student teacher responses Voice, School 5Essentials survey.    information survey measures school culture climate visit  https://www.5-essentials.org/cps/5e/2018/ creative_school_certification Creative Schools Certification (CSC) identifies level arts instruction school five categories Emerging Excelling. involved_families Category 5 Essentials survey: school partner families communities? supportive_environment Category 5 Essentials survey: school safe supportive high expectations? ambitious_teaching Category 5 Essentials survey: instruction focused, challenging, engaging? effective_leaders Category 5 Essentials survey: leadership focus results school improvement? school_survey_safety Category 5 Essentials survey: students feel safe school support positive behavior? attainment_math_pct_es Students' attainment math. attainment_reading_pct_es Students' attainment reading. student_attendance_pct2019 Attendance students Public School Chicago year 2018-2019. teacher_attendance_pct2019 Attendance teachers Public School Chicago year 2018-2019. chronic_truancy_pct chronic truant student 9 unexcused absences school year    (5 percent days enrolled).

title: Chicago Public Schools school ratings — cps
text: https://data.cityofchicago.org/Education/Chicago-Public-Schools-School-Progress-Reports-SY1/dw27-rash

what: Emotion scores from 2016 presidential debate — emotion
title: Emotion scores from 2016 presidential debate — emotion
text: data frame containing predicted emotion scores first 2016 US presidential debate. row score emotion type either Trump Clinton frame video. Emotion scores calculated using Microsoft Emotion API.

title: Emotion scores from 2016 presidential debate — emotion
Emotion scores from 2016 presidential debate — emotion
text: data frame 128,688 rows 11 variables: start start time first event, ticks. video   30000 ticks per second. duration length fragment, ticks. interval length event within fragment, ticks. id Trump Clinton. x X coordinate top-left corner face. y Y coordinate top-left corner face. width Width face. height Height face. row_id ID video frame. key Type emotion measured. value Probability facial expression expresses emotion.

title: Emotion scores from 2016 presidential debate — emotion
text: https://blog.exploratory.io/analyzing-emotions-using-facial-expressions--video--microsoft-ai--r-8f7585dd0780

title: US Mass Shootings — mass_shootings
text: data frame 124 rows 14 variables: case Short name incident. year Year shooting occurred. month Month shooting occurred. day Day shooting occurred. location City state shooting occurred. summary Brief text description mass shooting incident. fatalities Number fatal victims incident (excluding shooter). injured Number injured, non-fatal victims incident (excluding shooter). total_victims Number total victims incident (excluding shooter). location_type Generic location shooting occurred. male Logical value indicating perpetrator male. age_of_shooter Age perpetrator incident occurred. race Race shooter. prior_mental_illness perpetrator show evidence mental illness prior incident?

text: https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2012/12/mass-shootings-mother-jones-full-data/

Voter turnout and mental health — mental_health
text: data frame 1317 rows 5 variables: vote96 1 respondent voted 1996 presidential   election, 0 otherwise age Age respondent educ Number years formal education completed respondent female 1 respondent female, 0 male mhealth Index variable assesses respondent's   mental health, ranging 0 (individual depressed mood)   9 (individual severe depressed mood).

title: Mean squared error — mse

what: Police usage of deadly force in the United States — police_shootings
title: Police usage of deadly force in the United States — police_shootings
text: dataset containing records every fatal shooting United States police officer line duty since Jan. 1, 2015.

title: Police usage of deadly force in the United States — police_shootings
Police usage of deadly force in the United States — police_shootings
text: data frame 5259 rows 10 variables: manner_of_death victim died. Either shot shot tasered. armed Indicates victim armed sort implement   police officer believed inflict harm. One unarmed, undetermined, unknown,   text description item victim armed. age age victim. gender gender victim. Uses binary classification method (e.g. male female).   Identifies victims gender identify reports indicate   differs biological sex. race Identifies victim either White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic),   Asian, Native American, Hispanic, , None. state Two letter postal code abbreviation. signs_of_mental_illness News reports indicated victim history   mental health issues, expressed suicidal intentions experiencing mental   distress time shooting. threat_level subjective label used identify severity threat faced   police office. attack category meant flag highest level threat.   undetermined categories represent remaining cases. includes   many incidents officers others faced significant threats. flee News reports indicated victim moving away officers. Coded   fleeing foot, fleeing car, fleeing. body_camera News reports indicated officer wearing body camera   may recorded portion incident.
